name: Neophytes: Kiryat Hamelacha
description:
‘Neophytes: Kiryat Hamelacha’ continues my inquiry into identity's physical, emotional, and poetic dimensions. In this work, I focus on the local queer community in Tel Aviv, utilizing a downtown industrial area known as ‘Kiryat Hamelacha’ as my studio.

By photographing queer individuals, I aim to delve into the rituals surrounding identity and the profound significance of living in a constant state of change. The term "neophytes" refers to those who are neither fully integrated into a specific place or class but exist in a perpetual state of transition.

Throughout the series, I revisit some individuals with whom I have already begun a dialogue, as introduced in my previous work, while incorporating new faces I have encountered. This project underscores the importance of community and seeks to explore the experience of being queer within the intricate reality of Israel-Palestine.
